column4: It seems to me essential - to get the real benefit of dual boot - to share a user files partition of some kind. Maybe I will try ntfs then
ntfs for the windows partition and ext3 for the linux ones (you can mount ext3 in windows but not ext4)

I have pretty much decided on ntfs for the windows system installation and ext4 for the linux system. My question is what is best for a third "user files" partition for files that I want to be able to work on from a choice of OSs
